name: Grand Bahia Principe La Romana

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2010, traveled with family
reviews.text: I am not a fan of long haul flights as I take a few days to adjust so Egypt was our first choice but now our kids have basically reached adult price we were finding it hard to find a deal for half term. So the Dominican Republic came up trumps as it was the best deal we could find when paying adults prices for kids.
reviews.title: A Great Time Had by All :)

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I have been to the Dominican Republic before on the north of the Island in a sister hotel so I sort of knew what to expect. The Journey approx 9 hours by plane and then another 2 by bus. Its was a long day.
reviews.title: brilliant but be aware

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010
reviews.text: When we arrived at the hotel we were greeted in the Golden Club with a drink and given our packs which included the keys. We were then taken to the room and our luggage followed.
reviews.title: Home 2 days and wished I was back there already

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had 2 junior suites on ground level in block 25 which gave us a pool view. The rooms were very tidy and well equipped. Like I said I take a bit of time to adjust so I was up the first morning at about 5am so the coffee machine and dressing gown came in handy while sitting on the balcony watching dawn break. There was a noise at about 6.20 ish every morning that sounded like a chain saw, could not not hear it in the room but very loud while on the balcony. It was not until about day 4 I realised it was hotel groundsmen spraying the bushes to try and reduce the mosquitos. Then the water sprayers would turn on and more groundsmen would appear to tidy the green areas with the pool staff in the background cleaning the pool. This ritual was normally over before 8 and way before the main traffic came through who like me really appreciated the surroundings.
reviews.title: Value for money

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were generally impressed by the food in the main buffet and beach shack where we went for a snack most lunch times as it was nearer the pool/beach. The 3 themed restaurants were ok, but the choice was slim even though adequate for the amount of times you would probably eat there. The staff in the main buffet did a good job and could only assume when it is peak season they would lay on more staff and I never saw the buffet area more than half full during our stay. While we were there we did not actually hear of anyone having a poorly tummy but I am convinced this is normally caused by freezing cold drinks in baking heat.
reviews.title: great hotel ,only one problem

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I were on our "honeymoon". From the time we arrived we were treated poorly. Nobody seemed to want to acknowledge you..............unless you spoke their language. Most of the staff could not even speak English.
reviews.title: Terrible Experience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010
reviews.text: Their restaurants you had to make a reservation for, were a joke. You ordered your entree, but had to go to the buffet table to get the remainder of your meal.
reviews.title: Nice Hotel shame about the high theft rate!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Both the red and white wines comes from a plastic jug! No even close to drinkable.
reviews.title: Incredibly clean, relaxing, good value for money

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled with family
reviews.text: I could go on, but the bottom line is................the service was terrible, the staff very unfriendly.
reviews.title: Fun times, friendly People!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled with family
reviews.text: The hotel in general is spotless throughout with beautiful gardens. The food is nice, sometimes not boiling hot but there was plenty to choose from. Had a lovely 2 weeks relaxing and plenty of activities to join in with if you feel like it. The showers are a little bit hit and miss temperature wise especially at the end of the day.
reviews.title: fab holiday

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Booked this holiday based on the stays we have had at other Bahia Principe Hotels elsewhere in the Dominican, Mexico and Tenerife. This hotel was not up to the standard of any of them (with the exception of San Juan which was terrible 6 yrs ago), particularly in relation to the food.
reviews.title: Hotel Nice - Shame about the Food and Attitude of some staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The hotel grounds and pool were nice. The watersports on the beach were good but as others have said, while we were there the sea was never clear enough for snorkeling.
reviews.title: Don`t Believe Bad Reviews Its A Superb Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The rooms were smaller than those we have stayed in at other Bahia Principe resorts but no smaller than a lot of other hotels we have stayed in, and the colour scheme in them could certainly be brightened up and seemed quite dreary particularly on days when we stayed in the room because of bad weather (obviously the weather was not the hotels fault!!). Other Bahia Principe rooms at other hotels have always been bright and cheerful. When we arrived, the shower did not work properly and the ceiling fan sounded like a spitfire airplane engine. We reported these and they were fixed within 24 hours but we had to lose 6 hours of holiday time while the technicians were coming as the hotel security policy did not allow them to come into the room if we were not not present.
reviews.title: Excellent

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The food - Poor. The buffet restaurant food was the same virtually every day and always looked dry in the hot plates even though the staff often stirred the dishes to try and break up the skin on the gravy, stir in the dried scrambled egg withthe moist underneath etc. I am an easy person to please foodwise and eat most things but on 2 occasions in 7 nights I could not find anything in the buffet I fancied eating. We only tried the Seafood speciality restaurant and were not impressed. Others said that the Gourmet Restaurant was nice though - particularly the lamb, but otherwise the speciality restaurants were nothing to write home about..
reviews.title: Excellent value for promo price

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: As we went away for my wife's 50th birthday and I wanted it to be special for her, particularly as she has been poorly the past few months, I decided that we would request a transfer to a different hotel for the last 9 nights of our 16 night holiday, where I could be assured of having an experience like we were expecting. The Thomson Rep (Christian Dyer) was very helpful in arranging this for us although we thought that the $75.00 fee charged by Thomsons on top of the upgraded hotel charge, as an arrangement fee was a bit steep. We moved to the Dreams Resort at La Romana and would recommend that hotel to anyone even though it will cost you about £200 more for a 2 week holiday.
reviews.title: Dont listen to the bad reviews it is beautiful

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Arrived at the Gran Bahia Principe La Romana after the usual long trip, on checking in we were upgraded. Dont worry if you are not , all rooms are the same and your upgrade is a robe, slippers, change beach towels easy and a bit of a sea view depending where you are located.
reviews.title: Definately not a 4/5 star hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled with friends
reviews.text: The hotel reception and lounge area are very clean and comfortable, the rooms are very nice and clean, the grounds , swimming pool and beach are maintained to a high standard.
reviews.title: no way five star

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: On the beach you will get bitten by Mosquitoes and Sand fly's, the sea is murky and has jelly fish in so you can get stung. Mosquitoes are the main problem at night, no amount of sprays or Repellents will stop them biting you badly (cover up).
reviews.title: From someone who never goes on this kind of holiday

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Well we all expect the food to be different and have to make allowances, unfortunately the hot food was always luke warm and always in some sort of sauce.Regardless of where you are in the world this Chef here had a big problem with putting together combinations of dishes for breakfast , lunch and dinner. None of dishes seemed to be local to the area or representitive of the various countries on themed nights .
reviews.title: 3 Star brothel with cold food

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Dont bother with the beach snack bar, food served their is terrible. Thats if you get served at all, their is no garantee you will get your food even if you manage to order it.
reviews.title: dont believe everything you read

aka: Gran Bahia Principe La Romana Hotel
